Your turn begins as soon as the previous player's turn ends. When you have arranged your cards as desired, proceed to phase 1.

If you fought a monster during phase 1, skip this phase and go to phase 3. If you did NOT draw a monster when you first opened the door, you have two choices: either Look For Trouble or Loot The Room.

- Play a monster from your hand and fight it, just as if you had found it when you kicked open the door. Do not play a monster you cannot handle, unless you're sure you can count on getting help (see [Help](#help) on page 4)!

### Loot The Room
- Draw a second card from the Door deck, face down, and place it in your hand.

Each character is defined by their weapons, armor, and magic items, with three main stats: Level, Race, and Class. For example, you might describe your character as a "Level 8 Elf Wizard with Boots of Butt-Kicking, a Staff of Napalm, and the Kneepads of Allure."

Your turn begins as soon as the previous player's turn ends. When you have arranged your cards as desired, proceed to phase 1.

## Phase 1: Kick Open The Door

Your turn begins as soon as the previous player's turn ends. When you have arranged your cards as desired, proceed to phase 1.

## Phase 1: Kick Open The Door
- Draw one card from the Door deck and turn it face up.
- If it's a monster, you must fight it. Refer to [Combat](#combat) on page 3.
- If the card is a curse, apply it to you immediately (if possible) and discard it (unless it has a persistent effect or you keep the card as a reminder of an upcoming effect).
- If you draw any other card, you may either put it in your hand or play it immediately.

## Phase 2: Look For Trouble/Loot The Room
If you fought a monster during phase 1, skip this phase and go to phase 3. If you did NOT draw a monster when you first opened the door, you have two choices: either Look For Trouble or Loot The Room.

### Look For Trouble
- Play a monster from your hand and fight it, just as if you had found it when you kicked open the door. Do not play a monster you cannot handle, unless you're sure you can count on getting help (see [Help](#help) on page 4)!

### Loot The Room
- Draw a second card from the Door deck, face down, and place it in your hand.

## Phase 3: Charity
- If you have more than five cards in your hand, you must play enough cards to get you to five or below. For example, you can play Curses, sell Items from your hand, or play Items to the table.

Note: If someone plays a "your next combat" Curse on you while you are in combat, it counts in that combat! The same is true for a "your next turn" Curse played during your turn.

Starting and Finishing the Game

Determine the first player by rolling the dice and engaging in discussion about the results. The meaning of this sentence and any perceived missing words should be considered.

Gameplay proceeds in turns, each consisting of several phases (see page 2). Once the first player completes their turn, the next player to the left takes their turn, and so on.
